alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 10:30PM AKST until March 02 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A storm force low is moving towards the northern gulf coast and will stall out during the day on Wednesday. Snow has began to spread over the northern panhandle tonight and will continue to move south through Wednesday. Temperatures are remaining below freezing with dewpoints in the 20s. All communities throughout SEAK are still expected to see snow but some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals for the southern half of the panhandle as southerly flow will cause a mix of rain/snow or even a complete change to rain through Wednesday evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern inner channels. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight AKST Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall expected late Tuesday night and during the day Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
